		Parcel Number:17 02350001008 *Block:--Lot:--Subdivision:--

sever decayReason for Removal:Significant cavity/area of decayComments:1. Purpose of Assessment
 This assessment was requested by the neighboring property owner and conducted to evaluate the potential risk posed
 by a mature tulip poplar tree located at the rear right corner of the property. The assessment was performed at the
 Level 2: Basic (Limited Visual) level following the ISA Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ) methodology.
 2. Site & Target
 Tree Location: Rear right corner of subject property, ?5 ft from property line.
 Primary Targets: Residence on subject property, neighboring residence, fence line, and yard use areas.
 Site Use: High-value residential setting with frequent occupancy and use.
 3. Tree Condition & Observations
 Stem/Trunk:- Extensive vertical wound wood and decay column present along the main trunk, extending from the base upward.- Internal decay depth estimated between 12 inches and 2 feet.- Structural compromise with open cavities and exposed decayed wood.
 Crown/Canopy:- Significant dieback throughout canopy tips.- History of branch failure including recent limb breakage.- Major decay at 2/3 canopy height visible on main leader with central decay extending fully through the
 cross-section.
 Physiological Condition:- Stress response growth (epicormic sprouting) noted along trunk.- Reduced vigor and crown density.
 Recent Maintenance History:- Tree pruned within the past year for dieback removal.
 4. Risk Analysis

This tree is too close to the foundation of the house. The roots are causing foundation/ crawl space issues for the homeowner.Reason for Removal:Within 5 ft of occupied dwellingComments:Ribbon
